results.title: The Heart of England
results.creator_credit: Michael Clarke, Edgar H. Anstey and British Transport Films
results.brief_description: The heart of England lies in the Cotswold country. The changes in the seasons bring to this area are seen first in early spring, with the harrowing of the rich fields, the first buds on the trees, the blossoming orchards. Later comes the Three Counties Show at Hereford, cricket at Cheltenham on the village green, and finally the harvest and the traditional fairs.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Michael Clarke, Edgar H. Anstey and British Transport Films

results.title: The Haunting of Barney Palmer
results.brief_description: Barney Palmer was eight years old when his haunting began, Whispers in the waves, images in the mirror, voices in his dreams. Is it the ghost of his great Uncle Barnaby or is it the ghost of somebody not yet dead? Someone, somewhere in this world or in the next is promising to carry him away. For Barney, the answer lies close within the strength of his home.

results.brief_description: An animated film which presents an adaptation of Oscar Wilde’s story of “The Happy Prince”. Narrated by Christopher Plummer and Glynis Johns.

results.title: The Ham artist = The Face on the bar room floor [SOUND]
results.creator_credit: Charles Chaplin, Mack Sennett, Mack Sennett Comedies and W H Productions
results.brief_description: A burlesque of the famous poem by Hugh Antoine D’Arcy of the broken-down artist who, having lost his wife to another man, draws her face on the floor and then passes out, drunk. Sound version with piano accompaniament.

results.title: The Ham artist = The Face on the bar room floor [SILENT]
results.creator_credit: Charles Chaplin, Mack Sennett, Keystone Film Company and Mack Sennett Comedies
results.brief_description: The plot is a satire derived from Hugh Antoine D’Arcy’s poem “The Face on the bar room floor. It tells of the broken-down artist (Charlie Chaplin) who, having lost his wife (Cecile Arnold) to another man, draws her face on the floor of a bar room. Charlie tells his tragic story in flashbacks. NB: Silent film with no soundtrack.
results.title_for_label: The Ham artist = The Face on the bar room floor [SILENT]
results.creator_credit_for_label: Charles Chaplin, Mack Sennett, Keystone Film Company and Mack Sennett Comedies

results.title: The Gypsy moth
results.brief_description: The uncontrolled spread of the gypsy moth is creating a serious problem that is difficult to estimate economically. In this film the audience sees the type and extent of the damage caused by these prolific insects, as well as the ease with which they are transported from one area to another by unsuspecting humans. The moth was introduced to North America from Europe in 7869 by a scientist, and has now spread with insufficient naturel predators, thereby causing great damage to Canada’s forests and crops. Superb photography.

results.title: The Grizzly bear: a case study in field research
results.creator_credit: Irwin Rosten and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Scientists Frank and john Craighead roam Yellowstone National Park armed with drug filled darts in order to study the formidable grizzly. Narrated by Alexander Scourby.

results.title: The Greening

results.title: The Green plant
results.brief_description: Aspects of all forms of plant life; their fundamental functions (respiration, intake of food and outlet of waste matter, irritability etc.) Exist here as in the higher forms of life. The basic construction of a plant is described; the way it feeds and grows.
